column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Get Children to Eat a Healthy Breakfast
#Text=Having a healthy breakfast is a great idea and an excellent way to start anyone 's day .
#Text=Children have high nutritional needs .

#Text=Giving your child a tasty , nutrious breakfast may help their memory during the day , provide them with energy and decrease their chances of developing conditions related to bad eating habits , such as type 2 diabetes .
#Text=Get started at step number one below for how to get children of all ages to eat a healthy breakfast .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Make time for breakfast .
#Text=Eating a healthy breakfast should not be a special event , it should be a daily occurrence .
#Text=This means your children have to get up out of bed and be at the breakfast table in time to have a morning meal and still have time to ready for school , nursery or college .
#Text=As a parent , it is your job to have breakfast ready .
#Text=Help your children get up in time to eat , or if they are old enough , make sure they have what they need to get up in time , e.g. alarm clocks , and enough sleep .
#Text=Provide a choice of breakfast foods .
#Text=Children should be allowed to choose how much they eat , and what , as long as they choose from what is on offer and do eat something .
#Text=If you have a fussy eater , serve a small amount of something you know they will enjoy to make sure they do eat something .
#Text=Try offering wholemeal foods for breakfast .
#Text=Whole grain oats made into porridge , whole grain cereals and whole grain breads are all good options .
#Text=Eggs make a good nutritious breakfast if you have the time to prepare them .
#Text=Fruit and yoghurt are good options too .
#Text=Depending on the age of your child , offer whole milk .
#Text=Think about what other cultures have at a morning meal to provide variety .
#Text=Use breakfast to include some of the five plus portions of fruit and vegetables your child should eat everyday .

#Text=It 's easy to incorporate things like a small glass of freshly squeezed orange juice , a banana , some blueberries , a grilled tomato , some sauteed mushrooms , a half grapefruit , a tangerine , a portion of dried fruit , etc into a healthy breakfast based on something more substantial like cereal , toast or porridge .
#Text=Avoid sugary cereals - even those aimed at children !
#Text=Highly processed white bread , ready-made pancakes , pop-tarts , cereal bars and waffles are also unhealthy choices .
#Text=Be positive about breakfast instead of being negative .
#Text=For example instead or saying " you need to eat your breakfast " say " it 's important to eat your breakfast so you can be healthy and strong " .
#Text=Eat breakfast together as a family .
#Text=Do n't just make your kids eat a healthy breakfast - get yourself and your partner involved too .
#Text=Maybe on weekends you and your family can all cook breakfast together - make breakfast fun .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Avoid getting into fights over breakfast , this turns breakfast into a bad time instead of a fun time .
#Text=It 's OK to have an unhealthy breakfast once in a while as a treat .
#Text=Let your kids choose a healthy breakfast they like .
#Text=Try putting fruit on top of porridge or oatmeal .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Forcing your child to eat breakfast may lead to eating disorders later in life .
